result.execSummary:
The defendant Cameron E. Mentzel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant can not be employed or volunteer in any atmosphere where he has to interact with minors.

Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with E.R.M. dob 12/20/2001 without prior approval by his Agent.
Defendant to have no contact with any other minors without prior approval by his Agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall participate in sex offender treatment and follow any treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
Defendant to register as a sex offender and be in compliance with the registry.

timeConds.notes: 30 days stayed - to be utilized by Agent upon application to the Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
